steps: In a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, instant yeast, sugar, and salt.
Add warm water and melted butter to the dry ingredients.
Mix until a dough forms and knead it on a floured surface for about 10 minutes.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let it rise in a warm area for about 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
Punch down the risen dough, shape it into a loaf, and place it in a greased loaf pan.
Cover and let it rise for another 30 minutes.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.
Remove from the oven and let it cool before slicing.
